greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest pseudoprime (>prime(n)) to base prime(n).
link: Eric Chen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..4096
example: a(7) = 45 because the 7th prime is 17, and the smallest pseudoprime (> 17) to base 17 is 45.
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{b = Prime[n], k = Prime[n] + 1}, While[PrimeQ[k] || PowerMod[b, k - 1, k] != 1, k++]; k]; Array[f, 60]
results.author: _Eric Chen_, Feb 21 2015
